topic.title: B.28 Regular way contracts: no established market

p.b: Can a contract to purchase a financial asset be a regular way contract if there is no established market for trading such a contract?

body.p: Yes. IFRSÂ 9 refers to terms that require delivery of the asset within the time frame established generally by regulation or convention in the marketplace concerned. Marketplace is not limited to a formal stock exchange or organised over-the-counter market. Instead, it means the environment in which the financial asset is customarily exchanged. An acceptable time frame would be the period reasonably and customarily required for the parties to complete the transaction and prepare and execute closing documents.
For example, a market for private issue financial instruments can be a marketplace.
